intro: Silene shanbashakensis, commonly known as the Armenian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Silene shanbashakensis has small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It blooms during the summer months, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystem.
